front.title: Postcard-based On-Path Flow Data Telemetry using Packet Marking

abstract.t: The document describes a packet-marking variation of the Postcard- Based Telemetry (PBT), referred to as PBT-M. Similar to the instruction-based PBT (i.e., IOAM DEX), PBT-M does not carry the telemetry data in user packets but send the telemetry data through a dedicated packet. Unlike the instruction-based PBT, PBT-M does not require an extra instruction header. PBT-M raises some unique issues that need to be considered. This document formally describes the high level scheme and cover the common requirements and issues when applying PBT-M in different networks. PBT-M is complementary to the other on-path telemetry schemes such as IOAM.
